dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson run out (Prasad/†Sangakkara) 97 (95b 8x4 2x6 141m) SR: 102.1

dismissalComment.html: gets down for the paddle sweep as he looks for the gap through backward square. Williamson wants two right away, but Taylor is guilty of ball watching as he has his back turned to his partner, and doesn't see how he has come all the way down to his end before deciding to go back. Sangakkara receives the throw from the deep before rattling away a throw at the non-striker's which connects. A really unlucky way for Williamson to go as he badly deserved this hundred. Big wicket for SL there

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor lbw b Dilshan 96 (102b 7x4 2x6 141m) SR: 94.11

dismissalComment.html: tossed up on middle and leg as Taylor is late on this, looking to tickle this behind through fine leg. Dilshan likes it, and the umpire acquiesces, but Taylor wants a review. Struck him on the toe with nothing on HotSpot either. It is all red so Taylor has to go, and unfortunately for him, he falls just 4 short of his century. Joins Williamson as the other 90-er in the innings

138 kph, what a catch from Perera! Brendon is gone! Huge wicket for the Sri Lankans! Brendon dances down the track as he looks to clobber Prasad through the covers, and that too just second ball. Ends up miscuing this high over long off, with the fielder having to run behind to take the catch as he fell over in his attempt to balance

142 kph, after much trial and error, the plan has come off as Ronchi departs the oval after slicing a wide, full delivery from Prasad over extra-cover, with the fielder able to take the catch comfortably

and Anderson's little cameo comes to an end as he holes out high over cow corner as he looked for another heave through that favoured area of his. Was looking increasingly dangerous as his stay prolonged at the crease

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum c Perera b Prasad 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: 138 kph, what a catch from Perera! Brendon is gone! Huge wicket for the Sri Lankans! Brendon dances down the track as he looks to clobber Prasad through the covers, and that too just second ball. Ends up miscuing this high over long off, with the fielder having to run behind to take the catch as he fell over in his attempt to balance

dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill c †Sangakkara b Perera 28 (43b 4x4 0x6 64m) SR: 65.11

dismissalComment.html: 129 kph, gets this to nip back from a length outside off as he is struck on the top of his front pad. May have got an inside-edge as the ball continued on to brush the thigh pad before finding its way to the keeper. Didn't look that affected by it, but he will have to go as the umpire reverses the decision

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson run out (Prasad/†Sangakkara) 97 (95b 8x4 2x6 141m) SR: 102.1

dismissalComment.html: gets down for the paddle sweep as he looks for the gap through backward square. Williamson wants two right away, but Taylor is guilty of ball watching as he has his back turned to his partner, and doesn't see how he has come all the way down to his end before deciding to go back. Sangakkara receives the throw from the deep before rattling away a throw at the non-striker's which connects. A really unlucky way for Williamson to go as he badly deserved this hundred. Big wicket for SL there

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson c Perera b Herath 40 (28b 5x4 1x6 45m) SR: 142.85

dismissalComment.html: and Anderson's little cameo comes to an end as he holes out high over cow corner as he looked for another heave through that favoured area of his. Was looking increasingly dangerous as his stay prolonged at the crease

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor lbw b Dilshan 96 (102b 7x4 2x6 141m) SR: 94.11

dismissalComment.html: tossed up on middle and leg as Taylor is late on this, looking to tickle this behind through fine leg. Dilshan likes it, and the umpire acquiesces, but Taylor wants a review. Struck him on the toe with nothing on HotSpot either. It is all red so Taylor has to go, and unfortunately for him, he falls just 4 short of his century. Joins Williamson as the other 90-er in the innings

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi c Karunaratne b Prasad 13 (13b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: 142 kph, after much trial and error, the plan has come off as Ronchi departs the oval after slicing a wide, full delivery from Prasad over extra-cover, with the fielder able to take the catch comfortably

dismissalText.commentary: Daniel Vettori run out (†Sangakkara/Prasad) 3 (3b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: 117 kph, excellent slow bouncer from Prasad which Vettori was looking to hook but is late on. Elliott guns for his end so Vettori takes the cue, but is short of his ground as Sangakkara scrambles a throw to Prasad, who is able to reach out to knock over the stumps with Vettori short of his ground at the non-striker's

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Mills run out (Karunaratne/Prasad) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: 142 kph, in the zone for the drive which Elliott does, as this one races away through extra-cover. Mills to get back for the second before the throw but is picked off with his bat on the line. Mills has to go as he was at the danger end

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Vettori b Boult 81 (66b 7x4 2x6 106m) SR: 122.72

dismissalComment.html: 135 kph, and Boult has landed the Big Kahuna as Sangakkara, forced at this point to deal with an escalating required rate, ends up getting a leading edge to this one he looked to flick behind square, with the ball spooning up to mid on, who takes the catch comfortably. That could be the final death blow for Sri Lanka, despite having the two wickets still in hand. But you know cricket, it is never over till the fat lady sings!

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c †Ronchi b McClenaghan 29 (43b 2x4 0x6 62m) SR: 67.44

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, McClenaghan strikes for his captain now as he removes Lahiru from the crease after the left-hander tickled one going down the leg side which Ronchi was wise to as he got into position quickly to take the catch low to his right. Almost spilled it too upon second viewing of the catch, but safe in the end

137 kph, short of a length and Dilshan has to go as he offers up a feather of an edge which Ronchi takes gleefully from behind. Was looking to get down and bludgeon this through the line, but the extra bounce did him in. Big wicket for NZ as Dilshan has already reeled off two hundreds in the five matches prior

136 kph, fuller one outside off and Mahela is not three times lucky as he endeavours to chip Anderson over mid off, but ends up mishitting it as Brendon takes the simplest of catches. Big scalp that for NZ. Mahela furious with himself as he storms to the pavilion

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, Dimuth looking for the open space at midwicket as he tried to club this through the line, but the bat opened up at the last moment to offer up a top-edge which goes over to Mills at mid on, who takes it quite comfortably

135 kph, Anderson strikes Perera right in front as the umpire goes straight up with the finger. Sangakkara urges his partner to go for the review regardless. HotSpot shows no deflection, and the ball looks to have struck on the knee roll. Only question is whether this one hit in line. Ends up being ruled as out as the impact is umpire's call. The gamble fails to come off for SL as Perera exists without too much fuss

133 kph, McClenaghan strikes for his captain now as he removes Lahiru from the crease after the left-hander tickled one going down the leg side which Ronchi was wise to as he got into position quickly to take the catch low to his right. Almost spilled it too upon second viewing of the catch, but safe in the end

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: and Guptill ends it all after Lakmal goes after this back of a length, looking to cart it over midwicket, but gets a top-edge which flies right over the wicket, with Guptill taking the catch just over the non-striker's end

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †Ronchi b Anderson 21 (36b 3x4 0x6 56m) SR: 58.33

dismissalComment.html: 137 kph, short of a length and Dilshan has to go as he offers up a feather of an edge which Ronchi takes gleefully from behind. Was looking to get down and bludgeon this through the line, but the extra bounce did him in. Big wicket for NZ as Dilshan has already reeled off two hundreds in the five matches prior

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c †Ronchi b McClenaghan 29 (43b 2x4 0x6 62m) SR: 67.44

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, McClenaghan strikes for his captain now as he removes Lahiru from the crease after the left-hander tickled one going down the leg side which Ronchi was wise to as he got into position quickly to take the catch low to his right. Almost spilled it too upon second viewing of the catch, but safe in the end

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c McCullum b Anderson 9 (18b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: 136 kph, fuller one outside off and Mahela is not three times lucky as he endeavours to chip Anderson over mid off, but ends up mishitting it as Brendon takes the simplest of catches. Big scalp that for NZ. Mahela furious with himself as he storms to the pavilion

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, Dimuth looking for the open space at midwicket as he tried to club this through the line, but the bat opened up at the last moment to offer up a top-edge which goes over to Mills at mid on, who takes it quite comfortably

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal run out (McCullum/†Ronchi) 9 (12b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: oh no! What has happened? Chandimal calls for a quick single to the off side as he plays with soft hands. Kumar is intent on following through with the call, but sees the danger coming from the off side as the fielder picks up and fires in a throw to Ronchi. Sends Chandimal back, but he reacts too late as he is not even in the picture when the bails are whisked off by the keeper. Sangakkara apologises to him,but it won't prevent them from losing another key wicket as this chase gets into the business end

dismissalText.commentary: Jeevan Mendis run out (Anderson/Vettori/†Ronchi) 3 (8b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 37.5

dismissalComment.html: this is just poor running from Mendis. Breakdown in communication with Sangakkara as this one is cut away to extra-cover, with the batsman looking to complete two before he sees his partner not reacting at the other end. Mendis turns on the spot, and puts in the dive, but comically lands about a metre short of his crease as he falls flat on the ground. Tries to get his bat across, but crucially lets go off the handle. The throw, which was initially fired in at the wrong end, is quickly dispatched by the bowler to Ronchi, who whips off the bails as Mendis lies on the ground, wondering about better days

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera lbw b Anderson 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: 135 kph, Anderson strikes Perera right in front as the umpire goes straight up with the finger. Sangakkara urges his partner to go for the review regardless. HotSpot shows no deflection, and the ball looks to have struck on the knee roll. Only question is whether this one hit in line. Ends up being ruled as out as the impact is umpire's call. The gamble fails to come off for SL as Perera exists without too much fuss

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Vettori b Boult 81 (66b 7x4 2x6 106m) SR: 122.72

dismissalComment.html: 135 kph, and Boult has landed the Big Kahuna as Sangakkara, forced at this point to deal with an escalating required rate, ends up getting a leading edge to this one he looked to flick behind square, with the ball spooning up to mid on, who takes the catch comfortably. That could be the final death blow for Sri Lanka, despite having the two wickets still in hand. But you know cricket, it is never over till the fat lady sings!

dismissalText.commentary: Dhammika Prasad run out (Mills) 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 15.38

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, NZ have to be the best fielding outfit going around! Another brilliant run-out effected, this time by Mills as he makes a late decision to throw at the non-striker's after there was a mix-up in the middle between the two. Prasad ends up trying to get down to the other end, but is short of his crease when the throw hits the stumps. Nine down now SL and it looks all but over in Dunedin

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Suranga Lakmal c Guptill b McClenaghan 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: and Guptill ends it all after Lakmal goes after this back of a length, looking to cart it over midwicket, but gets a top-edge which flies right over the wicket, with Guptill taking the catch just over the non-striker's end

dismissalText.commentary: Suranga Lakmal c Guptill b McClenaghan 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 60

commentTextItems.html: and Guptill ends it all after Lakmal goes after this back of a length, looking to cart it over midwicket, but gets a top-edge which flies right over the wicket, with Guptill taking the catch just over the non-striker's end

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.30 pm So we leave the sunny shores of Dunedin as the party moves on to Wellington on January 29 for the final ODI of the series. Sri Lanka will badly want to end this tour on a good note, while the hosts would not want to squander the momentum they have incurred thus far through these performances. It has been a superb day of cricket, and we hope you all thoroughly enjoyed it as well. Till the next time then, this is ESPNcricinfo signing off!
Fat Lady : "Oh Danny Boy, The Cup, the Cup is coming..."

Corey Anderson, Man of the Match: You are not always going to get wickets, but today it was nice. Brendon was talking to me quite a bit and backed me up. It was nice to get through ten overs today as well. Feeling reasonably good with the bat, and I thought the way Rosco and Kane played helped make my job easier. It has been really good here in Dunedin. It has been hot so it is nice to see the crowds as well.
Anderson is the Man of the Match

Lahiru Thirimanne, Sri Lanka captain: Our concern is our death bowling. We bowled the first 35 very good, but not so in the last 15 overs. We couldn't get any wickets and we leaked runs. We need to come out of this strong. Our fast bowlers don't have much experience, especially with Nuwan and Lasith out. Lasith should be okay for the World Cup. This is all a learning curve for the young boys. Hopefully we can get it right for the World Cup. Kumar played very well in this series, but our middle order needs to be more consistent. That is our main concern. We do have another game to make this right and get our confidence right for the World Cup

Brendon McCullum, New Zealand captain: It was a thorough performance today. We came in against a very good SL team. The partnerships we built on the way to 315 was very good, and the bowlers came through in the end as well. Very happy with the series win. We try to be reasonably aggressive at the start, but we do have some quality batsmen who can spend time out in the middle. We have the options and some class players to help us get the balance right. Corey I thought was really good today. Kept running in hard and taking wickets and being aggressive with the ball. Ross went very well and missed out on a big total there. You are never going to be 100% as you do crave that perfection. As long as you strive to keep getting better and have the right attitude then we can do some good things.
We will be back shortly with quotes from the match presentation.

6.15pm New Zealand complete yet another sizable victory in Dunedin, this time sealing it by 120 runs, and win the series as they take an unassailable 4-1 lead in the series. Twin 90s from Taylor and Williamson provided the framework for the first innings, before some good, disciplined bowling ensured Sri Lanka could never run away with it. Sangakkara did his best to keep this one going, but once he perished, it was only a matter of time before New Zealand finished off the job. Anderson is the pick of the bowlers having taken figures of 4 for 52.

commentTextItems.html: 129 kph, slips in the bouncer which is well over Lakmal's head as the umpire signals to the scorer

commentPostTextItems.html: Kumar: "What is Thirumanne thinking by making Lakmal bat? Does he expect that Lakmal and Herath will get SL over the line. This will do more harm than good cause this might aggravate Lakmal's injury."

commentTextItems.html: 135 kph, picks up this length ball on middle and leg and lifts it high over cow corner, but not enough to beat a chasing McCullum, who puts in a splendid dive before the rope to save the run
135 kph, brings the hammer down as this is fended away to the off side
127 kph, gets a bottom-edge to this attempted pull through midwicket, but the ball ends up falling short of Ronchi as he went after it

commentPostTextItems.html: CharlyPharly: "Sri Lanka know their strengths - three of the best ODI batsman in the world. They know their weaknesses - middle lower order batting and 3-5 bowling. They need to work within that framework and work out the best strategy. I think put your best three batsman at 3, 4 and 5 (i.e. swap Dilshan down the order), and open with some aggressive risky stroke makers. "

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

commentTextItems.html: 130 kph, pitches it up a bit further as Herath seems to be stuck in an infinite loop
128 kph, another play-and-a-miss from Herath as he is late again on this fullish ball
128 kph, is well late on this fuller one going across him as he looks to caress this through the covers
126 kph, pulls the bowler straight past him to find the long on fielder

commentPreTextItems.html: And after that wonderful fielding effort before, Mills has been handed the ball to try and finish this off

commentTextItems.html: 126 kph, deliberated whether to go after this one outside his off stump, but decides against it

dismissalText.commentary: Dhammika Prasad run out (Mills) 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 15.38

commentTextItems.html: 133 kph, NZ have to be the best fielding outfit going around! Another brilliant run-out effected, this time by Mills as he makes a late decision to throw at the non-striker's after there was a mix-up in the middle between the two. Prasad ends up trying to get down to the other end, but is short of his crease when the throw hits the stumps. Nine down now SL and it looks all but over in Dunedin

commentPostTextItems.html: Lakmal will indeed bat then. Brave stuff from him as he has a groin injury to contend with as well

commentTextItems.html: 134 kph, tries to guide one away square off the wicket, but doesn't quite middle it
131 kph, gets onto the back foot before working this one away through mid off
131 kph, is well late on this length ball going across him

commentPostTextItems.html: Fat Lady: "You rang? I was thinking about doing Danny Boy in honor of the man of the day."

commentTextItems.html: 133 kph, delivers one on middle and leg as Prasad deflects it away

commentPreTextItems.html: Brendon looking to mix it up as McClenaghan comes on to bowl

commentTextItems.html: 128 kph, strikes Prasad just above the knee roll as he puts in a hopeful shout, but the umpire remains nonplussed
139 kph, slips one down the leg side now as this is flicked away efficiently to deep fine leg

commentPostTextItems.html: shihan: "That awkward moment when Prasad's batting avg higher than Mendis :)"

commentPreTextItems.html: This could also be the last wicket for SL with Suranga Lakmal's groin injury. Might not even bat him in an effort to preserve him for the next match. Rangana Herath is the new batsman for SL

commentTextItems.html: 137 kph, able to just about get away this back of a length through the leg side

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Vettori b Boult 81 (66b 7x4 2x6 106m) SR: 122.72

commentTextItems.html: 135 kph, and Boult has landed the Big Kahuna as Sangakkara, forced at this point to deal with an escalating required rate, ends up getting a leading edge to this one he looked to flick behind square, with the ball spooning up to mid on, who takes the catch comfortably. That could be the final death blow for Sri Lanka, despite having the two wickets still in hand. But you know cricket, it is never over till the fat lady sings!

commentPostTextItems.html: Huge interest among the crowd now with Sangakkara's exit. He was the chief wicket for all parties involved till then.

commentTextItems.html: 133 kph, this time goes wide of third man with an uppish slice that beats the boundary rider to the rope

commentPostTextItems.html: ajit: "I think NZ is hitting a real watershed moment in terms of talent - perhaps like Australia had a while ago. Is Anderson really hitting close to 140kph on top of his batting ability. And Neesham, who can do the same is not even in the squad? People need to pay attention because we are witnessing the start of an amazing turn in NZ cricket."

Didn't look that affected by it, but he will have to go as the umpire reverses the decision

tossed up on middle and leg as Taylor is late on this, looking to tickle this behind through fine leg. Dilshan likes it, and the umpire acquiesces, but Taylor wants a review. Struck him on the toe with nothing on HotSpot either. It is all red so Taylor has to go, and unfortunately for him, he falls just 4 short of his century. Joins Williamson as the other 90-er in the innings

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum c Perera b Prasad 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: 138 kph, what a catch from Perera! Brendon is gone! Huge wicket for the Sri Lankans! Brendon dances down the track as he looks to clobber Prasad through the covers, and that too just second ball. Ends up miscuing this high over long off, with the fielder having to run behind to take the catch as he fell over in his attempt to balance

dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill c †Sangakkara b Perera 28 (43b 4x4 0x6 64m) SR: 65.11

dismissalComment.html: 129 kph, gets this to nip back from a length outside off as he is struck on the top of his front pad. May have got an inside-edge as the ball continued on to brush the thigh pad before finding its way to the keeper. Didn't look that affected by it, but he will have to go as the umpire reverses the decision

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson run out (Prasad/†Sangakkara) 97 (95b 8x4 2x6 141m) SR: 102.1

dismissalComment.html: gets down for the paddle sweep as he looks for the gap through backward square. Williamson wants two right away, but Taylor is guilty of ball watching as he has his back turned to his partner, and doesn't see how he has come all the way down to his end before deciding to go back. Sangakkara receives the throw from the deep before rattling away a throw at the non-striker's which connects. A really unlucky way for Williamson to go as he badly deserved this hundred. Big wicket for SL there

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson c Perera b Herath 40 (28b 5x4 1x6 45m) SR: 142.85

dismissalComment.html: and Anderson's little cameo comes to an end as he holes out high over cow corner as he looked for another heave through that favoured area of his. Was looking increasingly dangerous as his stay prolonged at the crease

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor lbw b Dilshan 96 (102b 7x4 2x6 141m) SR: 94.11

dismissalComment.html: tossed up on middle and leg as Taylor is late on this, looking to tickle this behind through fine leg. Dilshan likes it, and the umpire acquiesces, but Taylor wants a review. Struck him on the toe with nothing on HotSpot either. It is all red so Taylor has to go, and unfortunately for him, he falls just 4 short of his century. Joins Williamson as the other 90-er in the innings

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi c Karunaratne b Prasad 13 (13b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: 142 kph, after much trial and error, the plan has come off as Ronchi departs the oval after slicing a wide, full delivery from Prasad over extra-cover, with the fielder able to take the catch comfortably

dismissalText.commentary: Daniel Vettori run out (†Sangakkara/Prasad) 3 (3b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: 117 kph, excellent slow bouncer from Prasad which Vettori was looking to hook but is late on. Elliott guns for his end so Vettori takes the cue, but is short of his ground as Sangakkara scrambles a throw to Prasad, who is able to reach out to knock over the stumps with Vettori short of his ground at the non-striker's

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Mills run out (Karunaratne/Prasad) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: 142 kph, in the zone for the drive which Elliott does, as this one races away through extra-cover. Mills to get back for the second before the throw but is picked off with his bat on the line. Mills has to go as he was at the danger end

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c †Ronchi b McClenaghan 29 (43b 2x4 0x6 62m) SR: 67.44

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, McClenaghan strikes for his captain now as he removes Lahiru from the crease after the left-hander tickled one going down the leg side which Ronchi was wise to as he got into position quickly to take the catch low to his right. Almost spilled it too upon second viewing of the catch, but safe in the end

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †Ronchi b Anderson 21 (36b 3x4 0x6 56m) SR: 58.33

dismissalComment.html: 137 kph, short of a length and Dilshan has to go as he offers up a feather of an edge which Ronchi takes gleefully from behind. Was looking to get down and bludgeon this through the line, but the extra bounce did him in. Big wicket for NZ as Dilshan has already reeled off two hundreds in the five matches prior

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Vettori b Boult 81 (66b 7x4 2x6 106m) SR: 122.72

dismissalComment.html: 135 kph, and Boult has landed the Big Kahuna as Sangakkara, forced at this point to deal with an escalating required rate, ends up getting a leading edge to this one he looked to flick behind square, with the ball spooning up to mid on, who takes the catch comfortably. That could be the final death blow for Sri Lanka, despite having the two wickets still in hand. But you know cricket, it is never over till the fat lady sings!

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c McCullum b Anderson 9 (18b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: 136 kph, fuller one outside off and Mahela is not three times lucky as he endeavours to chip Anderson over mid off, but ends up mishitting it as Brendon takes the simplest of catches. Big scalp that for NZ. Mahela furious with himself as he storms to the pavilion

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Dimuth Karunaratne c Mills b Anderson 26 (34b 2x4 0x6 33m) SR: 76.47

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, Dimuth looking for the open space at midwicket as he tried to club this through the line, but the bat opened up at the last moment to offer up a top-edge which goes over to Mills at mid on, who takes it quite comfortably

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal run out (McCullum/†Ronchi) 9 (12b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: oh no! What has happened? Chandimal calls for a quick single to the off side as he plays with soft hands. Kumar is intent on following through with the call, but sees the danger coming from the off side as the fielder picks up and fires in a throw to Ronchi. Sends Chandimal back, but he reacts too late as he is not even in the picture when the bails are whisked off by the keeper. Sangakkara apologises to him,but it won't prevent them from losing another key wicket as this chase gets into the business end

dismissalText.commentary: Jeevan Mendis run out (Anderson/Vettori/†Ronchi) 3 (8b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 37.5

dismissalComment.html: this is just poor running from Mendis. Breakdown in communication with Sangakkara as this one is cut away to extra-cover, with the batsman looking to complete two before he sees his partner not reacting at the other end. Mendis turns on the spot, and puts in the dive, but comically lands about a metre short of his crease as he falls flat on the ground. Tries to get his bat across, but crucially lets go off the handle. The throw, which was initially fired in at the wrong end, is quickly dispatched by the bowler to Ronchi, who whips off the bails as Mendis lies on the ground, wondering about better days

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera lbw b Anderson 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: 135 kph, Anderson strikes Perera right in front as the umpire goes straight up with the finger. Sangakkara urges his partner to go for the review regardless. HotSpot shows no deflection, and the ball looks to have struck on the knee roll. Only question is whether this one hit in line. Ends up being ruled as out as the impact is umpire's call. The gamble fails to come off for SL as Perera exists without too much fuss

dismissalText.commentary: Dhammika Prasad run out (Mills) 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 15.38

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, NZ have to be the best fielding outfit going around! Another brilliant run-out effected, this time by Mills as he makes a late decision to throw at the non-striker's after there was a mix-up in the middle between the two. Prasad ends up trying to get down to the other end, but is short of his crease when the throw hits the stumps. Nine down now SL and it looks all but over in Dunedin

dismissalText.commentary: Rangana Herath not out 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 20

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Suranga Lakmal c Guptill b McClenaghan 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: and Guptill ends it all after Lakmal goes after this back of a length, looking to cart it over midwicket, but gets a top-edge which flies right over the wicket, with Guptill taking the catch just over the non-striker's end

135 kph, and Boult has landed the Big Kahuna as Sangakkara, forced at this point to deal with an escalating required rate, ends up getting a leading edge to this one he looked to flick behind square, with the ball spooning up to mid on, who takes the catch comfortably. Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 39 runs, 1 wicket)
New Zealand: 50 runs in 11.5 overs (71 balls), Extras 5
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 63 balls (MJ Guptill 26, KS Williamson 20, Ex 5)
Drinks: New Zealand - 66/2 in 16.0 overs (KS Williamson 29, LRPL Taylor 4)
New Zealand: 100 runs in 23.1 overs (139 balls), Extras 5
KS Williamson: 50 off 60 balls (5 x 4, 1 x 6)
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 62 balls (KS Williamson 25, LRPL Taylor 26, Ex 0)
New Zealand: 150 runs in 29.5 overs (179 balls), Extras 5
3rd Wicket: 100 runs in 103 balls (KS Williamson 58, LRPL Taylor 42, Ex 0)
Drinks: New Zealand - 172/2 in 33.0 overs (KS Williamson 94, LRPL Taylor 45)
LRPL Taylor: 50 off 68 balls (3 x 4)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 48 runs, 0 wicket)
New Zealand: 200 runs in 36.6 overs (222 balls), Extras 5
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 35 balls (LRPL Taylor 28, CJ Anderson 21, Ex 4)
Over 41.1: Review by Sri Lanka (Bowling), Umpire - DJ Walker, Batsman - CJ Anderson (Struck down)
New Zealand: 250 runs in 42.5 overs (257 balls), Extras 10
Over 46.1: Review by New Zealand (Batting), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - L Ronchi (Struck down)
New Zealand: 300 runs in 48.2 overs (290 balls), Extras 16
Innings Break: New Zealand - 315/8 in 50.0 overs (GD Elliott 21)
Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 42 runs, 0 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 11.1 overs (67 balls), Extras 6
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 67 balls (HDRL Thirimanne 25, TM Dilshan 20, Ex 6)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 72/2 in 16.0 overs (KC Sangakkara 9, DPMD Jayawardene 5)
Over 17.2: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - DJ Walker, Batsman - DPMD Jayawardene (Upheld)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 21.6 overs (133 balls), Extras 8
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 49 balls (KC Sangakkara 34, FDM Karunaratne 19, Ex 0)
KC Sangakkara: 50 off 39 balls (5 x 4, 1 x 6)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 29.6 overs (181 balls), Extras 8

milestones.description: Vettori has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (280) for NZ, going past Fleming

stories.title: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 2014-15
stories.subTitle: 6th ODI, Dunedin
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 2014-15
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the sixth ODI, New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 2014-15

stories.title: 'I wasn't out of form' - Taylor
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 6th ODI, Dunedin
stories.summary: Ross Taylor had not scored a fifty during Sri Lanka's visit until his 96 in Dunedin on Sunday, but despite a string of mediocre scores, the batsman said he had never been out of form

stories.title: Unavailable DRS leaves SL fuming
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 6th ODI, Dunedin
stories.summary: Technical malfunction prevented Sri Lanka from reviewing an lbw decision against Martin Guptill in the fourth over of the sixth ODI in Dunedin, causing significant displeasure among the fielding team

image.longCaption: Dhammika Prasad appeals for an lbw against Martin Guptill, New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 6th ODI, Dunedin, January 25, 2015

stories.title: NZ take series with 120-run win
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 6th ODI, Dunedin
stories.summary: A 117-run third-wicket stand between Kane Williamson and Ross Taylor was the centrepiece of New Zealand's imposing 315 for 8, which founded a 120-run victory against an ailing Sri Lanka
stories.byline: The Report by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Ross Taylor clubs the ball through the leg side
image.longCaption: Ross Taylor clubs the ball through the leg side, New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 6th ODI, Dunedin, January 25, 2015

stories.title: New Zealand's chance to close out series
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 6th ODI, Dunedin
stories.seoTitle: New Zealand's chance to close out series
stories.summary: New Zealand are leading 3-1 and a victory on Sunday in Dunedin will give them the series against Sri Lanka
stories.byline: The Preview by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.longCaption: Brendon McCullum congratulates Tillakaratne Dilshan as he leaves the field, New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Dunedin, January 23, 2015

videos.title: Can Sri Lanka bounce back?
videos.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 6th ODI, Dunedin
videos.summary: After suffering an onslaught from New Zealand's Luke Ronchi and Grant Elliott, Sri Lanka need to win the sixth ODI in Dunedin to keep the series alive

recentReportStory.title: NZ take series with 120-run win
recentReportStory.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 6th ODI, Dunedin
recentReportStory.summary: A 117-run third-wicket stand between Kane Williamson and Ross Taylor was the centrepiece of New Zealand's imposing 315 for 8, which founded a 120-run victory against an ailing Sri Lanka
recentReportStory.byline: The Report by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Ross Taylor clubs the ball through the leg side
image.longCaption: Ross Taylor clubs the ball through the leg side, New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 6th ODI, Dunedin, January 25, 2015

recentReportStory.credit: Andrew Fidel Fernando is ESPNcricinfo's Sri Lanka correspondent. @andrewffernando

recentPreviewStory.title: New Zealand's chance to close out series
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 6th ODI, Dunedin
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: New Zealand's chance to close out series
recentPreviewStory.summary: New Zealand are leading 3-1 and a victory on Sunday in Dunedin will give them the series against Sri Lanka
recentPreviewStory.byline: The Preview by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Brendon McCullum congratulates Tillakaratne Dilshan as he leaves the field
